ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Request for harware help
ygData.msgSnippet: I use a ProThrottle from CH Products.  Functionally, it works like a game pad in that it has buttons that are programmable and will send keystrokes when you
ygData.messageBody:
I use a "ProThrottle" from CH Products. Functionally, it works like a game
pad in that it has buttons that are programmable and will send keystrokes
when you click them. But the manufacturer and presumably the design is
different from yours. Does your work with "other games" ?? Ie: is it a
Gravis install issue or an EQ issue?

From time to time in my gaming career, I have had to fight battles with
joystick drivers. Sometimes, you could load the equipment and program it
with the OEM software but the OEM drivers would not work with Windows. So,
you had to set the joystick/gameport to a generic one (two-axis/two button)
to get things to work or to partially work.

Sometimes you needed to have the resources set to a very specific port
setting in device manager - resources (201-201 for a certain joystick I once
had would work where 200-209 would fail.) And of course if you have
conflicting interuppts or memory addresses, you need to resolve those.

Mine hooks up inline with my keyboard cable so it can send in keystrokes.
If the Gravis tries to do it through redirecting the calls to the keystroke
interupts and EQ is polling that area of ram directly - there could be
trouble. Are there any 'switches' or jumpers on the Gravis you can set?
Call Gravis Tech Supp? Do they know if it will work with EQ?

Sorry that I cant be more help,

Sylly

p.s. I splurged on Friday and overnited 2 x 128 meg PC100 ram sticks and a
generic TNT2 agp card. basically my 2nd pc (P2-333 128 meg old STB agp
Lightspeed D3D) was doggin' badly in Kunark. Now it's much better <g> Both
boxes have 256meg ramski and decent vid cards. Sorry John Kim - I vastly
prefer my VooDoo3 3k and glide over TNT2 D3D - D3D is very granular and the
gamma is way off (of course a 3rd party program adjusts it for me and even
my hummies can kinda see now.)


----- Original Message -----
From: "Ronnie Roads" <rkroads@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 01, 2000 2:44 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Request for harware help


> From time to time we get onto a hardware topic; my turn ;). Sylly, I have
heard you
> say you use a gamepad yes?
>
> I bought a Gravis GamePad Pro USB and it just won't work. I downloaded
the latest
> driver from Gravis. I bound it to EQ and defined keys but nothing
happens.
>
> Any suggestions? Thanks =).
>
>
> Maravana Vireo
